channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Roc Camera
item.description:
Lost sight of what is real Lostsightofwhatisreal We've started to lose sight of what is real in an endless sea of copies, AI-generated noise, and altered realities. It's time for Roc Camera It'stimeforRocCamera By combining sensors, an on-device zero-knowledge proofs, and a tamper-proof environment for attesting sensor data, We've built Roc Camera to capture verifiably real moments. 5 Ghz • LiPo 4000mAh Battery • Uninterruptible Power Supply Board Capture Capture a photo that only this Camera can uniquely take Prove Creates a Zero Knowledge (ZK) Proof of the camera sensor data and other metadatas Verify Verify that the photo is real by checking the ZK proof via the Roc Photo SDK Capture verifiably real moments Accepting orders now — Batch 2 Ships in 2~3 weeks $399 USD Order.

Read more

item.title: JupyterGIS breaks through to the next level
item.description:
A symbology panel that applies graduated, categorized, and canonical symbology to vector tile layers. The identify tool in action with a pmtiles vector dataset. Browsing a STAC access catalog from JupyterGIS.

item.title: Apple loses UK App Store monopoly case, penalty might near $2B
item.description:
AAPL Company App Store Apple loses UK App Store monopoly case, penalty might near $2 billion Ryan Christoffel | Oct 23 2025 - 10:33 am PT 6 Comments A landmark case in the UK concerning Apple’s App Store practices has just been decided, with a London tribunal ruling against the company in a move that could cost Apple up to $2 billion. London tribunal rules that Apple overcharged app developers for years with unfair commissions Sam Tobin writes at Reuters: Apple abused its dominant position by charging app developers unfair commissions, a London tribunal ruled on Thursday, in a blow which could leave the U. Check out our exclusive stories, reviews, how-tos, and subscribe to our YouTube channel Check out 9to5Mac on YouTube for more Apple news: Comments Expand Close comments Expand Close comments Guides AAPL Company Breaking news from Cupertino.
